畫質:N/A

音樂:中品

以前Half life沒有特別的音樂,後果加入了主題曲(怪怪的...)

耐玩:上品

有多人連線,還有大量的玩家自制地圖及模式,都十幾年了,還有很多支持者呢

難度:中品

的確與一般無腦突突突不同,Half life含少量解迷,甚至卡關,不過玩熟了故事的人則無此問題

操作:上品

WASD罷了...

特別加分:經典

總體為上品,值得收藏!

This game is easily one of the best games I have ever played in my life. This game truly feels like I'm playing through a movie. I had a hard time getting into it for the first few levels but I am very happy that I stuck through it because Half Life has provided me with one of the best gaming experiences I have ever had. Anyone who is a fan of FPS needs to play this game, It is worth every penny (and all the time which you will invest in it).
An excellent mix of the intese action of a shooter and the tense atmosphere that makes you apprehensive all the game long. Definitely, one of the best of all times. 11 out of 10
Great game, fantastic to finally be able to play it on a Mac. It's exactly as it was on the PC. Classic game, easy to play, still enjoyable. Thank you for making it available.

Half-life is a pretty well-known game, it's got that old PC game feel, which could be considered good or bad, on one hand, yes, older games often offered a very powerful challenge, but on the downside, this was mostly caused by the fact that game design was something that had to be learned solely through hands-on experience, due to it being a new concept for people to work with. You play as Gordon Freeman, a mute scientist, majored in Theoretical Physics. You start off entering the Black Mesa facility for an experiment, which, naturally, goes horribly wrong, afterwards, Gordon finds himself trapped in the facility, surrounded by bizarre creatures you would NOT find on our planet. Your goal is to escape from the facility while combatting the many creatures that have invaded, as well as some marines, who have been given orders to kill the scientists to cover up the incident. The majority of the challenge in the game comes from utilizing your resources, because unlike other games there are no areas where you can heal and reload, instead you'll find various ammunition located across the game, but none of it is durable, and the only weapons in the game that don't use ammo are the melee crowbar, and this hornet firing weapon you get rather late in the game. The only places you can heal up infinitely are these small pools that only begin to show up VERY late in the game. So basically you have to find out how to dispatch various enemies while utilizing as few resources as possible. This is a very nice challenge, but sometimes it just comes down to you saving before attempting something, and simply experimenting to see how little of your resources you can expend. The game was significantly longer than I had expected, and is very challenging, I got this game when it was on sale for 75% off, for 2.25$, I ended up getting the Half-Life pack for 75% off, for an overall 10$, since you can get the whole package for the same price as you can get this game alone when it's on sale, I'd recommend waiting for it to go on sale, overall I'm glad I got this game, and I do recommend it.

If you're an atheist who loves science, a communist who hates our armed forces, or a vagrant who likes dinosaurs shooting electricity out of their eyes, then this game is for you. I don't recommend this game to anyone who loves Christ or is a wholesome American. There is far too much talk of science and killing of our loyal defenders of justice, the marines. This game gets a Steve Buscemi out of Nicholas Cage.

Der Erste Teil der berühmten Half-Life Serie. Der Beginn des Helden Gordon Freeman.
Das Spiel macht unglaublich viel Spaß, egal ob im Singleplayer oder im Deathmatch Online. Ich habe Stunden damit verbracht bis ich es durchgespielt hatte, und spiele es auch heute noch gern. Es zählt für mich zu einem der besten Spiele überhaupt!
Best FPS ever
Amazing

Easily one of the greatest videogames of all time. It does have its (few) flaws, but it makes up for them with a stunning storyline, fantastic gameplay (combining puzzles, shooting, and platforming),  and superb level design. Half-Life immerses you into the game like no other, and it still blows me away after 15 years.
good classic buy it if you you play black mesa source out of respect for the origanal developers.

one of the greatest first person shooters ever, and perhaps one of the greatest games i have ever played. strongly recommend. the game does not hold your hand, it just drops you in, no tutorials or anything, which is truly a double edged sword. the game is overally excellent and i strongly recommend buying it.

FANTASTIC!! Wow, love this game, and even 15 years afer it was released (I do realize I'm a little late in playing it) it is quite the adventure. Game is pretty difficult, but much better than modern shooters for sure! A MUST play!

Back then, I could see how amazing this game was. The graphics aren't terrible for today's standards, the effects are pretty cool, and managing your ammo with the amount of stuff you have to shoot is an interesting balance.

Of course, if you have been playing highly refined modern games, the story progression can be difficult at times. The movement has more of a gliding aspect than I would like, and some parts of the game are not as clearly empasized as they should be. There's nothing like in Portal 2 where lighting aids you to see where to place your portals.

With all of this in mind, I would still recommend this game. Even though I can only play an hour or two at a time due to frustration and confusion at times, I keep coming back to it. If you conside yourself a true Valve/PC gamer, I would seriously recommend you play this. It shows you where it all started.

The best multiplayer shooter geme of all time.
Absolute classic! Epic game!
Good, quiet, sometimes relaxing and mostly very hard. This is Half-Life 1. It is very different game than today new and modern games. You must  think and turn on your brain. :)
Old but gold <3

This game is the mother of the modern realistic FPS (for better or for worse), but seeing as I was born a month before it came out it's... slightly before my time. Nonetheless, I decided to buy it, and much later, to sit down and play through the entire thing just to get a sense of what exactly all this hype is about.

I've played some great single-player games and some pretty mediocre ones. This game, despite having been made in 1998, is still a spectacularly fun experience. It's definitely "retro", with low-quality textures, chunky models, funny metallic sheens, and even some 2D sprite particle effects. The AI shows its age, though the HECU can still be relied on to get you with a grenade every damn time you get cocky, and there's still a fair amount of challenge. 

 To someone who only nominally experienced the decade, this game feels very 90's in pretty much every way, but who's complaining about that these days? Overall, a lot of thought and care and fucking around went into this game, that's more you can say for far too many FPS games since this one. Definitely a must-play.
This game is a classic! I remember playing this back in the day when I was new to Half - Life, and I would recommend to gamers who enjoy the adventure with the story it brings.

The FPS adventure that kicked off Valve's success and set the tone for the rest of the FPS genre. There isn't much to say, other than the fact that Half-Life is way, way ahead of it's time. It is a benchmark in gaming history. No future FPS could truly call itself an FPS without first asking: Did we do it like Half-Life did? Plot, action, voice acting, everything. Play it and enjoy.

Half-Life gave me constant entertainment, I started playing Half-Life with Half-Life 2 and Episode one and two on Xbox 360. Lets just say that I loved the game and its DLC, so once I got a laptop I bought the Half-Life one Anthology that came with Half-Life, Half-Life Blue Shift, Half Life Opposing Force, and Team Fortress Classic. If you ever want to play this game you need to not be a graphic hater because this game has an outdated source engine that has lower graphic possibilitys as the current onr that runs things like Portal, Team Fortress 2, and Counterstrike: Global Offensive. If you need and "good graphic version" look up the Black Mesa mod. Over all This game is one of the best first person shooters that I have everplayed and I give it a 9 out of ten.

A game that starts off as a normal day for a man, until all hell breaks loose when you accidentally open a portal to a different world and  a bunch of strange creatures come out. You are Gordan Freeman, a twenty seven year old badass, who will fight his way out of the Black Mesa compound to save his life. How does he do it? Well, you'll just have to play the game and see. It's a simple concept of a game, survival, just like everyday life.
It's classic!

A Game unlike any other. Half-Life has set the standerd for action adventure FPS games. A must own for all PC gamers.

If you're looking for a challenge, buy this game. I mean it. It's hard. It's not as hard as those SNES games that you had to put  days of frustration into just to reach the final boss, only to die and have to start all over. Wait, actually it is. Be prepared to save a lot.

Despite it's difficulty this game offers a lot. The storyline, though hard to follow with old audio and no subtitles, is unique, as Valve storylines usually are. You should play this (and beat it) to get the beginning of Half-Life 2 (and some nostalgic stuff in it) but it's not necessary.

It's old and hard. The graphics aren't great and the audio is fuzzy. The game is fun, but not worth $10. Wait until it goes on sale. Pay no more than $5.

A classic game and certainly an interesting experience. It definitely shows its age, and if you don't like this, I encourage you to try out the Half Life 2 mod recreating this game in the newer engine. The game is plagued by poor level design and enemies that are far too difficult to kill (headcrabs particularly). Still, if you get through that, the game features some elaborate puzzles, great attention to detail, and a wide variety of playstyles. 7/10

A great sci-fi game filled with aliens from the border world Xen, scientists who think you're odd for running, black operations soldiers, and another force- the G-Man! Play it and you'll find an adventure through Black Mesa Laboratories which takes you through dangers and obstacles yet unknown to this world! Best of all, you play through the eyes of Gordon Freeman who REALLY knows how to use a crowbar!
One of my most favorite PC Games Ever!

This story of a physicist using an nth-dimensional cystalline structure to achieve a rudimentary cascading teleportation system acted as a pristine example of the narrative abilities for mouse based 3d games.

The Half-Life that started it all. Once played, you want to continue playing the entire saga and experience what the other sides have went through through the Black Mesa incident. I recommend this game because it inspired other great creations through its amazing story line and usage of science and action like Halo and many more.

When I first started playing this game I though the graphics were going to bother me, but ooooooh was I WRONG!  The game was so Smooth and clever and well balanced I just ouldn't complain.  I felt like there really Was a force out there trying to kill me!  not just some scripted story.  This game deserves it's legacy for it's true abilty to inerse the plaer, so deeply in it's world and reality.  It's like playing a childhood memory, it's just that real and perfect.
